item.title: PhD
item.description: Fundamental Conditions of Democracy: Inequality as Disturbing Factor of Democratic Consolidation (dissertation project) Duration: 02/2016 until 12/2022 In the 1990s and early 2000s, the economic shock in Central Eastern Europe (CEE) after the transformation was still tolerated, but with accession to the EU, it became clear that the expected level of prosperity would not be achieved for a long time. Nevertheless, the political systems of CEE could be considered consolidated.

item.title: G-EPIC (projekt work)
item.description: Gender Empowerment Through Politics in the Classroom 02/2023 - 01/2026, PI (Germany): Simone Abendschön Project staff (Germany): B. Philipp Kleer, Tim Schmidt Funded by: EU Horizon G-EPIC aims to tackle the challenge of gendered political inequality from an intersectional perspective, through a novel research programme that broadly assesses how the gender gap in political participation is learnt through interaction in a social educational context. It proposes to develop a systematic approach, to gain understanding of the state of play on gendered political inequality and then to design, pilot and evaluate inclusive school-based interventions (didactics) that foster the political self-efficacy of disadvantaged young girls in six European countries (Belgium, Czechia, Denmark, Germany, Spain and the United Kingdom).

item.title: Kinder im Landtag (projekt work)
item.description: Children in a German State Parliament: Lasting Learning Experiences of Primary Schoolchildren 12/2017 - 08/2018 Project heads: Simone Abendschön, Thorsten Faas Project staff: B. Philipp Kleer, Luisa Wingerter Funded by: State Parliament Rhineland-Palatinate The state parliament (Landtag) of the Bundesland Rhineland-Palatinate developed an out-of-school political education program in 2018, taking place in the Landtag itself. This new visiting program aimed exclusively at primary schoolchildren in grades 3 and 4. The program aimed at strengthening political knowledge and democratic understanding of children, especially with reference to the political context of the German federal Land.
